newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico's Avantel outlines phone traffic to date.
newsitem.headline: Mexico's Avantel outlines phone traffic to date.

text.p: Mexican telephone company Avantel has already placed some 6.3 million calls, worth about 18 million minutes, since Mexico's telecommunications market opened for competition last year, the company said in a statement on Wednesday.
Avantel is a joint venture between MCI Communications and Mexico's Grupo Financiero Banamex-Accival.

"Since we inaugurated our network, we have offered a growing range of services to business and residential customers, the number of which has grown substantially since the beginning of interconnection," said Manuel Sanchez Lugo, the firm's director general.
Beginning on January 1, competitors of former monopoly Telefonos de Mexico (Telmex) were allowed to connect to Telmex's extensive local network for a fee.
